scenarios.action: A major hurricane hits a heavily populated area of the country. What do you do?

options.reaction: Send in the military to help with relief efforts
Encourage private companies and charities to provide relief
Set up temporary housing and provide financial assistance
You're busy winning a golf tournament
Convert public property into temporary housing

scenarios.action: A national enemy threatens to fire a nuclear missile at one of your military bases. What do you do?
Your opponents organize a peaceful rally to protest something you did. How do you react?

options.reaction: Hold a press conference to address the protests
Clear out protesters with "less lethal" weapons
Ignore them, but they block a major highway for two days
Attend the protest and spend the day interacting with your opponents

scenarios.action: It is found that you have billions of dollars in assets still under your name. What do you do?

options.reaction: Put it in a blind trust

scenarios.action: You receive support from one person or group of your choice. Who do you choose?
Famine sweeps through a developing country

options.reaction: Invade them while they are weak

scenarios.action: Your population wants a new tax system

options.reaction: The current tax system works for the economy

scenarios.action: A new trade agreement is proposed

options.reaction: Accept, but it reduces American jobs
Negotiate it heavily in your favor

scenarios.action: The population demands healthcare reform

options.reaction: Free healthcare, but increase taxes to pay for it

scenarios.action: You were having an affair, but it gets exposed on national TV.

options.reaction: Claim it has no effect on your performance
Blame it on "fake news" in the media

scenarios.action: Illegal immigration has increased significantly in recent years. How do you solve the issue?

options.reaction: Build a wall to decrease it

scenarios.action: Terrorist attacks have increased lately. How do you deal with it?

options.reaction: Give more power and budget to the police
Close your borders to certain countries

scenarios.action: One of your high-ranking officials is accused of selling national secrets to an enemy country.

options.reaction: Fire them and find someone to fill the position
Move them to a less public position

scenarios.action: A huge forest fire threatens to ignite a major city. What do you do?

options.reaction: Force prisoners to contain it for free

scenarios.action: Citizens complain that the Controlled Substances Act is too strict.

options.reaction: Relax it and regulate newly legal drugs
Allow use of all homemade substances
Release people convicted of non-violent drug-related crimes

scenarios.action: Your administration is corrupt, and the FBI is investigating it.

options.reaction: Fire the head of the FBI
Bribe the FBI to stop investigating

scenarios.action: There is an outbreak of an extremely contagious disease. What is your reaction?

options.reaction: Enforce social distancing and a stay-at-home order
Allow it to spread, it's natural
Go on vacation to avoid catching it

scenarios.action: The scientific community wants you to do something about pollution and climate change. What do you do?
You need to make some cuts to balance your budget. What gets a budget cut?
The media asks you about your thoughts on immigration. How do you respond?
Refugees from a war-torn country wish to enter the United States. How do you handle this?

options.reaction: Allow them to stay in the U.S. and set up refugee camps
Allow them in, but with heavy monitoring

scenarios.action: People are complaining about a lack of available jobs. What do you do?

options.reaction: Force companies to manufacture in the U.S. but help them relocate

scenarios.action: Childhood obesity is on the rise. What do you do?
Water in certain cities has become highly contaminated, and poses a risk to citizens' health.

options.reaction: Find and fix the source of the issue in each city

scenarios.action: There is too much nuclear waste. How do you take care of it?

options.reaction: Develop nuclear reactors that can use nuclear waste as fuel
Build an underground storage facility to store it

scenarios.action: You pardon a non-violent criminal, under the condition that they somehow help you. Who do you choose?

options.reaction: An eccentric millionaire who refuses to pay taxes

scenarios.action: A major tech company won't give you access to their systems for surveillance.
A smaller country discovers large amounts of oil on their land.

options.reaction: Invade them to steal the oil
Force them into a trade deal

scenarios.action: A video surfaces of a police officer violating a citizen's rights. What do you do?

options.reaction: Prosecute the officer to the fullest extent of the law
Publicly disapprove of the officer but otherwise do nothing

scenarios.action: You accidentally like an inappropriate tweet. What do you do?
A foreign country's leader is assassinated by an American. What do you do?

options.reaction: Claim that the leader was a dictator building weapons of mass destruction
Deny that you had any involvement
Apologize profusely but do nothing of substance

scenarios.action: You accidentally say something stupid on national TV. What do you do?

options.reaction: Continue as if you never said it
Embrace and reinforce what you said
Joke about your mistake right after

scenarios.action: A region wants to secede from the U.S.A. What do you do?

options.reaction: Allow them to have a referendum
Remind them that secession is illegal
Give them tax incentives to stay

scenarios.action: A group of domestic terrorists voice their support for your administration and donate money to you.

options.reaction: Condemn their actions but take the money
Reject their support and their donations

scenarios.action: You receive your pay check. What do you do with it?

options.reaction: Add it to this year's bribery budget
Put it towards your re-election campaign

scenarios.action: An earthquake has destroyed a prescription drug manufacturing facility in the U.S.

options.reaction: Send them drugs while they rebuild

scenarios.action: A whistleblower exposes a government scandal on their website. What do you do?

options.reaction: Seize the website and shut it down
Track down and arrest the whistleblower
Dismiss the scandal as Fake News

scenarios.action: The NSA builds some viruses to help hack into their targets' computers, but accidentally releases them into the wild. What do you do?

options.reaction: Shut down the hacking program and destroy the evidence
Blame it on an enemy country
Develop and publish a patch for the exploits used

scenarios.action: Some of your decisions are causing you to be heavily criticized. What do you do?

options.reaction: Hold a press conference to explain your actions

scenarios.action: A large pharmaceutical company has caused an opioid addiction epidemic. What do you do?

options.reaction: Do nothing if they donate to you
Make them fix it, but they leave the country afterwards

scenarios.action: You run a deficit of trillions of dollars. How do you fix it?
Some conspiracy theorists accuse your administration of brainwashing the population. What do you do?
NASA wants to send astronauts to Mars, but needs more funding. What do you do?

options.reaction: Tell them to leave it to private companies
Rejected. It's a fraud, like the moon landing
Fund it if they can prove it'll make money
Fund it if they let you go to Mars

scenarios.action: You have a meeting with the leader of another country. What happens?

options.reaction: Trick them into a deal that favors you
You agree to lend them money

scenarios.action: You are losing a war in a foreign country. What do you do?

options.reaction: Tell your people it's going well, then keep fighting
Ask for support from your allies

scenarios.action: The World Health Organization predicts an impending pandemic and offers testing kits to the United States. How do you respond?

options.reaction: Submit them to the FDA for testing

scenarios.action: The speaker of the House of Representatives begins an impeachment inquiry against you, for allegedly consipiring against a political opponent. How do you respond?
A global disaster occurs, and there is a shortage of equipment. What do you do?

options.reaction: Import untested equipment from other countries
Say the disaster is a hoax

scenarios.action: You discover a President Simulation video game that appears to include jokes about you. How do you respond?

options.reaction: Encourage your supporters to write bad reviews
Force platform holders to remove it from their stores
Embrace the game and buy the expansion packs

scenarios.action: The population wants electoral reform. What do you do?

options.reaction: Refuse, the current system is fine

scenarios.action: There are some privacy concerns surrounding a popular social media platform that is based in an enemy country. What do you do?

options.reaction: Ban them, claiming you "have the authority"
Force them to sell out to Microsoft
Let them bribe you to stay

scenarios.action: A former President criticizes some of your actions. How do you respond?

options.reaction: Remind him he's not President anymore
Claim he wasn't a U.S. citizen anyway
Offer to debate him on TV

scenarios.action: At a presidential debate, you are asked to condemn white supremacists. What do you do?

options.reaction: Call for them to "stand back and stand by"
Remind your follower base to vote

scenarios.action: A negative hashtag about you trends on Twitter. How do you respond?
You and your supporters get suspended from Twitter. What do you do?

options.reaction: Force Twitter to reinstate your account

scenarios.action: You don't get your way. What do you do?

options.reaction: Encourage your fans to attack the Capitol
Run TV ads asking your supporters to vote for your interests

scenarios.action: Your favorite unhinged dictator invades a peaceful neighboring country for unknown reasons. What do you do?

options.reaction: Publicly disapprove of his actions but do nothing
Impose harsh sanctions on his country
Provide weapons to the country under attack

scenarios.action: Someone sends you a mysterious package with a suspicious white powder in it. What do you do?

options.reaction: Get it tested for safety before opening
Kindly ask people to send emails instead

scenarios.action: Women are being oppressed in a far-away country. What do you do?

options.reaction: Invade them to impose your morals
Help them come to the U.S.
Impose economic sanctions on that country

scenarios.action: You're running out of oil. What do you do?

options.reaction: Nationalize and ration remaining oil reserves

scenarios.action: An enemy country has taken an American celebrity captive. What do you do?

options.reaction: Exchange a war criminal from that country for the American
Pay them to free the American
Threaten to attack if they don't free your citizen

scenarios.action: An enemy country wants to start making nuclear weapons. What do you do?

options.reaction: Fund them if they ally with you
Nothing. They're too small to do anything

scenarios.action: An American oil tanker sinks near a small independent island in the Pacific ocean, causing a huge spill. What do you do?

options.reaction: Do nothing, but say it was cleaned up
Tell the island it's their responsibility

scenarios.action: The value of your currency is dropping. What do you do?

options.reaction: Adopt the currency of another country
Let businesses choose what to accept

scenarios.action: Dangerous and illegal items, such as chocolate eggs with toys inside them, keep being smuggled into the U.S. What do you do?

options.reaction: Legalize importing items that can only hurt the user

scenarios.action: You are discussing new immigration policies. Who do you want in your country?
An oil company wants to build a pipeline through the American Midwest, but some property owners are blocking its construction. What do you do?

options.reaction: Use eminent domain laws to forcibly acquire the necessary land
Tell the oil company to negotiate with the property owners
Send the army to vacate the land
Help them secretly build it underground

scenarios.action: What to do with prisoners is brought into discussion. What do you choose to do?

options.reaction: Make them do manual labor for free
Give them an education while in prison

scenarios.action: An American territory requests full statehood with a successful referendum.

options.reaction: Threaten to veto their statehood bill unless they pay you
Approve their request after careful review
Start taxing them without admitting them to the Union

scenarios.action: There is a war being fought on American soil, and you need to shelter your troops somewhere. What do you do?

options.reaction: Force citizens to share their homes

scenarios.action: The rich, including Members of Congress, are using a loophole in the tax code that allows them to pay less taxes. What do you do?

options.reaction: Call them out on it, but otherwise do nothing

scenarios.action: There is a debate between companies and students about unpaid internships. How do you settle it?

options.reaction: Set a special minimum wage for interns
Allow it only if requested by the student

scenarios.action: There has been an increase in gun violence lately. How do you respond?

options.reaction: Defend gun ownership as a Constitutional right
Require psychological tests for gun owners at the government's expense

scenarios.action: Stem cell research has the potential to help cure many diseases, but some are controversially harvested from fetuses. What do you do?

options.reaction: Encourage commercial uses of stem cells
Prohibit acquiring stem cells from fetuses

scenarios.action: Students complain of overwhelming student debt. What do you do?

options.reaction: Tell them to just work two jobs

scenarios.action: A pharmaceutical company increases the price of a rare medication by 50x. The public is outraged. What do you do?

options.reaction: Nothing. They own the drug, so they can
Investigate the CEO for securities fraud
Develop and distribute a generic version
Reduce the lifespan of drug patents
Nothing, if they give you a cut
Require insurance companies to pay the new price

scenarios.action: One of your drone strikes in an enemy country kills an American citizen. What do you do?

options.reaction: Deny the existence of a drone strike program
Compensate the family of the victim

scenarios.action: You wear a tan-colored suit to an important event, and some people are upset. How do your respond?

options.reaction: Apologize for wearing a tan suit
Threaten to wear a pink morphsuit to the next one

scenarios.action: A whistleblower reports that the NSA is conducting illegal surveillance of both Americans and citizens of other countries. What do you do?
The IRS has been found to be targeting your political opponents more harshly than others. What do you do?

options.reaction: Replace the head of the IRS
Conduct an audit of the IRS

scenarios.action: A White House intern is looking thicc. What do you do?

options.reaction: Leave a mess on the dress

scenarios.action: You've been caught using a private server for work emails instead of one provided by the State Department. How do you respond?

options.reaction: Claim you didn't know that wasn't allowed

scenarios.action: Classified documents have been discovered to be improperly stored at your personal residence. What do you do?

options.reaction: Take full responsibility and cooperate with the investigation
Blame a staff member for the mistake
Invoke executive privilege and refuse to cooperate with the investigation
Implement stricter security protocols for classified documents

scenarios.action: A nuclear power facility is reaching the end of its lifespan, but shutting it down would increase electricity prices nationwide. What do you do?

options.reaction: Renovate it to extend its lifespan
Shut it down and replace it with coal plants
Hide any danger from the public
Attempt to replace it with a wind farm

scenarios.action: A surveillance balloon belonging to an enemy country has been spotted flying above the U.S. What do you do?

options.reaction: Shoot it down and recover it
Jam its signal and collect intelligence from it
Keep it secret from the public
Have a meeting with the leader of that country

scenarios.action: Illegal drugs are found laying around the White House, probably left by one of your family members. What do you do?

options.reaction: Have the drugs destroyed and keep it secret from the public
Take a sniff while nobody's watching

scenarios.action: An F-35 fighter jet has malfunctioned, and its pilot has ejected from the aircraft. It is now flying on autopilot, and the military has no idea where it is. What do you do?

options.reaction: Ask the public to look for it
Keep it quiet, and send out a military search party for the jet
Buy another one and pretend the original never existed
Evacuate the potential crash area and pay for any property damage
Investigate how the military could simply lose an aircraft

scenarios.action: A large stadium event has a crowd crush, killing several people. What do you do?

options.reaction: Visit the families of the victims to offer your condolences
Enact federal building and crowd management laws for stadiums
Blame the crowd for being too rowdy
Investigate the organizers of the event for negligence
Ban festival seating at indoor events

endings.title: Elon Musk
endings.description: You made it to Mars, but there's not enough fuel for a return trip. You are remembered as the only U.S. President to flee the Earth.

endings.title: 'Murica
endings.description: Due to corruption, you are "asked" to resign. However, your actions have (miraculously) turbocharged the economy and your libertarian legacy will never be forgotten.

endings.title: Anarchy
endings.description: Without income, the government could no longer fund itself and shut down, creating a perfect storm for pirates to remotely terrorize the skies with drones.

endings.title: Communism
endings.description: You have achieved true communism, comrade. There can be no inequality if everyone is poor (except you, of course).

endings.title: McCarthyism
endings.description: Political donors on both sides are upset by your extreme tax policies, and run ads labelling you a "communist". Reputation ruined, you resign due to embarrassment.

endings.title: World War III
endings.description: One of your wars has escalated into a nuclear conflict involving all world powers, and humanity is destroyed. You are the last U.S. President.

endings.title: Nuked
endings.description: You allowed a small enemy nation to develop nuclear weapons. Unexpectedly, they attack Washington, D.C., killing you. You are remembered as an American martyr.

endings.title: Betrayed
endings.description: You shared national secrets with another country, who sold them to your enemies. Be careful who you trust.

endings.title: Revolution
endings.description: Mass protests break out to oppose your oppressive policies. The military sides with the people, leaving you no choice but to leave office.

endings.title: Dictatorship
endings.description: Faced with removal from office, you declare martial law, suspend the Constitution and name yourself Supreme Leader of the United States. Your reign of terror begins.

endings.title: Meltdown
endings.description: A nuclear power station has a system failure, causing a meltdown. The area is radioactive for 10,000 years, but your neglect is remembered forever.
